TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class ConsoleAction : System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl, System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler
.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ConsoleAction extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl implements class System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler
Public MustInherit Class ConsoleAction Inherits WebControl Implements IPostBackEventHandler
public ref class ConsoleAction abstract : System::Web::UI::WebControls::WebControl, System::Web::UI::IPostBackEventHandler

Docs.summary: Represents the base class which all specific console actions to be used in the ConsoleDataSource must inherit.

remarks.para: The Editing Menu, Quick Access Menu, or Site Actions menu present various actions to the user. Each of these menus contains an instance of the object that provides a hierarchical collection of objects, some of which implement the class. Each implementation of this class represents a specific action, such as Create Page, Publish, Show Version History, or Save and Stop Editing.

The code example presented here is simplified, but shows how a console action should be constructed. Running this sample application adds a "Save and Stop Editing" button to the Quick Access Menu. It requires that the page be in Edit mode and that the user have EditListItem permissions to this object. The sample uses ECMAScript (JavaScript, JScript) to post back to this control, and when it raises a postback event, the event saves the current object and shows the saved page in display mode.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string[] GetRibbonTabIdsWhereConsoleActionIsShown ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string[] GetRibbonTabIdsWhereConsoleActionIsShown() cil managed
Public Overridable Function GetRibbonTabIdsWhereConsoleActionIsShown () As String()

Docs.summary: Returns a list of ribbon tab IDs in which a object is shown.
Docs.returns: A list of ribbon tab IDs.

remarks.para: GetRibbonTabIdsWhereConsoleActionIsShown is a base method. It is overridden in subclasses that are shown on the ribbon. The list returns the IDs of all ribbon tabs in which the ConsoleAction object is shown.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IsCurrentlyEnabled ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsCurrentlyEnabled() cil managed
Public Overridable Function IsCurrentlyEnabled () As Boolean
public: virtual bool IsCurrentlyEnabled();

Docs.summary: Determines whether the specified object is currently enabled.
Docs.returns: true if the ConsoleAction object is currently enabled; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: The default return value for this method obtains the authoring state for the current page and invokes the IsCurrentlyEnabled method with the authoring state. Override the IsCurrentlyEnabled method when the authoring states are not required to make the call to determine whether the ConsoleAction object is enabled.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IsCurrentlyEnabled (Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.WebControls.AuthoringStates currentState);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsCurrentlyEnabled(valuetype Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.WebControls.AuthoringStates currentState) cil managed
Public Overridable Function IsCurrentlyEnabled (currentState As AuthoringStates) As Boolean
public: virtual bool IsCurrentlyEnabled(Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::WebControls::AuthoringStates currentState);

Docs.param: Bitmask of class that represents the current state of the page.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the is currently enabled.
Docs.returns: True if the is currently enabled; otherwise, False.

remarks.para: The default return value for this method checks the property against the current state of the page. In some situations, a bitwise AND of the class does not adequately define exactly when a object should be enabled. When this is the case, use this method to define the return Boolean value in a specific way.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string NavigateUrl { get; set; }
.property instance string NavigateUrl
Public Overridable Property NavigateUrl As String
public: virtual property System::String ^ NavigateUrl { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets the value of a object.
Docs.value: Either a URL for navigation or ECMAScript that runs when a user clicks the object.

remarks.para: When a user clicks a object on the page, this property determines how the Web browser responds. If the property specifies a conventional URL, the user is directed to the page located by that URL. If the property specifies JavaScript, the Web browser executes the script. For example, the script executed can include script to post back to the same action for the purpose of saving the current page.

Docs.param: Standard submitted from the Web browser.
Docs.summary: Represents code that is executed on the server when this object is clicked.

remarks.para: When this object is the target of a postback, this code is executed. This method is commonly used for actions that update the current or objects. Examples include Save, Approve, and PublishConsoleAction objects.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void RefreshCurrentItemAfterUpdate ();
.method public static hidebysig void RefreshCurrentItemAfterUpdate() cil managed
Public Shared Sub RefreshCurrentItemAfterUpdate ()
public: static void RefreshCurrentItemAfterUpdate();

Docs.summary: Refreshes the object that represents the current object.

remarks.para: Run this method at the end of a override in which the current object has been updated. When the current SPListItem is updated during a postback, it is necessary to refresh the item so that the page can be displayed correctly. If this is not done, the object may have succeeded, but the page may appear as though the did not occur.
For example, the may be to check in a page. If the current item is not refreshed, the page still appears checked out immediately after the is executed, although it was actually checked in.

Docs.summary: Gets an object that represents the authoring states required for this object to be enabled in the current context.
Docs.value: The states required for this object to be available.

remarks.para: When this object appears in the user interface, the value of this property determines whether the action is enabled or disabled.

Docs.summary: Indicates that the console action should render without tabs.
Docs.returns: true if the action is registered even when the ribbon tabs that are specified in GetRibbonTabIdsWhereConsoleActionIsShown are not available; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: This method can be overridden by console actions to provide logic that enables the action to be registered even when the specified ribbon tabs are not available.

that represents the current error message and options.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Microsoft.SharePoint.SPBasePermissions UserRights { get; }
.property instance valuetype Microsoft.SharePoint.SPBasePermissions UserRights
Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property UserRights As SPBasePermissions
public: abstract property Microsoft::SharePoint::SPBasePermissions UserRights { Microsoft::SharePoint::SPBasePermissions get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets an object that represents the user rights to use this object.
Docs.value: The rights mask representing the required rights.

remarks.para: This property must be implemented by all objects.
When the current user does not have the specified rights, this object does not appear in the user interface. The most restrictive value is .
